p: The CV curve of [NiAmben] obtained in the range of potentials from −0.9 to 0.9 V vs. Ag/Ag + (all potentials throughout the text are referred to this reference electrode) in the DMSO-based electrolyte displays three well pronounced irreversible oxidation waves with peak potentials at −0.05 V, 0.47 V, and 0.67 V, respectively ( Figure 2a). The voltammogram of [NiAmben] recorded in the range of potentials from −0.9 to 0.1 V shows a distinct oxidation peak at the peak potential E pa(I) = −0.05 V and a poorly defined reduction peak at E pc(I) = −0.35 V ( Figure 2b), which confirms that the first one-electron oxidation of [NiAmben] in DMSO is irreversible.
